quote: In Hollywood, you play a mom, and the next thing you know, you're on 'The Golden Girls.' They age you so fast.

Next thing you know, you're a country singer.

They're in a bubble the whole time.

Unlike a company that could spend a million dollars in two years and fail and there's nothing really to show for it, if you spend a million dollars on open source, you probably have something amazing that other people can build on.
If you come to my house, you won't see a wall of trophies or things like that. I'm sort of 'on to the next thing' all the time.

Tell God you can't make him laugh, but the next thing I know, my cooking show has become a hit, and they're asking for more seasons, and they want it to be in the States.

It's one of those things; you just get a very nice stroke from being included in the next thing.
Creatively, I try to always look forward and look at the next thing I want to do.

A lot of the time, when I'm choreographing, I'm not thinking about what movement look best next to the next movement - I'm actually thinking about what song and what sound sounds right next to the next thing. So kind of choreographing as if I'm always making a mix tape, so to speak.
Some people are just so happy to get published to, they sign anything. Next thing you know, they've signed over the rights to their book.
Yes, I was in that game where George Brett hit that home run. Billy saw there was too much pine tar on the bat and he went to the umpire, the next thing we knew they were fighting about it.
Sometimes I wish I lived more in the day, but I'm happier thinking about tomorrow or the day after. The way I see it, there's always a new or next thing.
The story grew, got way bigger than the contest rules called for, and next thing I knew I had a book.

I was supposed to do a film with Bill Shatner called 'Free Enterprise 2.' They were calling me into wardrobe, and they said they are holding off for a while. Then the next thing I knew... either the money dropped out, or the producer ran off with the money. I think it's the second story that's true.
Career is a mindset. The wrong mindset. Career is linear. Especially when you are trapped in the TV or film world. The next thing you do has always got to be bigger, or it is perceived as a failure.
It is certainly good to have fans but I am always focusing on the next thing and continuing to do good work. Onward and upward.

I was 12 years old, so auditioning for a TV show was something I didn't even think really happened. The next thing you know, I ended up booking the gig and I did four seasons on 'Emily of New Moon.' I got to learn on the job and kept going from there.
